text: Blue Mound is a city in Linn County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 219 people lived there. It is part of the Kansas City metropolitan area. ==History== Blue Mound was planned out in 1882. It was named Blue Mound because from far away, its elevation is said to look blue. ==Geography== Blue Mound is at (38.089357, -95.009926). The United States Census Bureau, the city has a total area of . Almost all of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 219 people, 95 households, and 50 families living in Blue Mound. Of the households, 81.1% owned their home and 18.9% rented their home. The median age was 43.9 years. Of the people, 90.4% were White, 0.9% were Black, 0.5% were from some other race, and 8.2% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 2.3% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 275 people, 111 households, and 75 families living in Blue Mound. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Blue Mound - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 346, local school district ;Maps * Blue Mound City Map, KDOT Category:Cities in Kansas Category:Linn County, Kansas
title: Blue Mound, Kansas
